Package simu.model

Class OwnEngine

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
simu.framework.Engine
simu.model.OwnEngine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable, IEngine
public class OwnEngine extends Engine
OwnEngine extends Engine and is the class for the simulation engine in the simulation.

  • Constructor Details

    • OwnEngine

      public OwnEngine(ISettingsControllerForM controller, double arrivalInterval, int rideCount, int ticketBoothCount, ArrayList<int[]> rideProperties, int restaurantCap, double wristbandChance)
      Constructor for the OwnEngine class. Initializes the simulation engine with the given parameters. Sets the time of the simulation to 0. Creates the service points for the simulation and assigns them IDs. Initializes the arrival progress for the simulation and generates the first arrival in the simulation.
      Parameters:
      controller - The controller for the simulation
      arrivalInterval - The interval between customer arrivals
      rideCount - The number of rides in the simulation
      ticketBoothCount - The number of ticket booths in the simulation
      rideProperties - The properties for the rides, such as mean and variance
      restaurantCap - The capacity of the restaurant
      wristbandChance - The chance of the customer being a wristband customer

      Init: Initializes the simulation engine and generates the first arrival to the system

    • runEvent

      protected void runEvent(Event t)
      RunEvent: Runs the B events in the simulation. Checks the type of the event and runs the corresponding event.
      Specified by:
      runEvent in class Engine
      Parameters:
      t - Event to be run

    • attemptCEvents

      protected void attemptCEvents()
      AttemptCEvents: Attempts to run the C events in the simulation. Begins service if the service point is not reserved and there are customers in the queue.
      Specified by:
      attemptCEvents in class Engine

      public void setWristbandChance(double amount)
      SetWristbandChance: Sets the chance of getting a wristband
      Parameters:

    • addResults

      public void addResults(Map results, String key, double value)

    • results

      protected void results()
      Results: Generates and summarizes the results of the simulation. Results are related to customer counts, ticket booths, customer times and service point specific results. Closes the simulation and visualizes the results in the results view.
      Specified by:
      results in class Engine

    • getWholeAverage

      protected double getWholeAverage()
      GetWholeAverage: Returns the average time that customers spend in the simulation regardless of the type of the customer
      Returns:
      The average time that customers spend in the simulation

    • getAverageWristbandTime

      public double getAverageWristbandTime()
      GetAverageWristbandTime: Returns the average time that wristband customers spend in the simulation
      Returns:
      The average time that wristband customers spend in the simulation, 0 if no wristband customers

    • getAverageTicketTime

      public double getAverageTicketTime()
      GetAverageTicketTime: Returns the average time that ticket customers spend in the simulation
      Returns:
      The average time that ticket customers spend in the simulation, 0 if no ticket customers

    • getWristbandTicketAverageRatio

      public double getWristbandTicketAverageRatio()
      GetWristbandTicketAverageRatio: Returns the ratio of the average time that ticket customers spend in the simulation to the average time that wristband customers spend in the simulation
      Returns:
      The ratio of the average time that ticket customers spend in the simulation to the average time that wristband customers spend in the simulation, 0.00 if no wristband or ticket customers
